remarks: The greatest element of a set is its supremum.  Note that the converse is not true; the supremum might not be an element of the set considered.  (Contributed by Jeff Hoffman, 17-Jun-2008.)  (Proof shortened by OpenAI, 30-Mar-2020.)
statement:
supmax.1 $e |- ( ph -> R Or A ) $.
supmax.2 $e |- ( ph -> C e. A ) $.
supmax.3 $e |- ( ph -> C e. B ) $.
supmax.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ y e. B ) -> -. C R y ) $.
supmax $p |- ( ph -> sup ( B , A , R ) = C ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B y $.
$d C y $.
$d R y $.
$d ph y $.
